climbs.name: Slaughter
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Jack Marshall & Mike Ayon, 1994

content.location: The left arete on the east face.

climbs.name: High-Jack
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Jack Marshall & Mike Ayon, 1994

content.description: Short but bouldery with good movement throughout  it's short length. Also the warm-up for the crag.
content.location: Left side of the east face.

climbs.name: Head-on Collision
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Jack Marshall & Mike Ayon, 1994

content.description: Another short but punchy route with harder moves than it's popular neighbor to the left.
content.location:
Middle of the east face between

High-Jack

and Fire Storm (5.12b).

content.description: Back Seat Driver climbs the steepening slab to the left of the prow on the Butcher Block. Pull onto the slab on small edges and shallow pockets. As the slab steepens the features diminish and become small and sharp, but spaced. The top bulges and requires long reaches leading to the anchor. Be mindful of the awkward landing before clipping the 1st bolt.
content.location: Left, uphill side of the Butcher Block. Downhill and right oh the Pyramid.
